abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit for Decentralization Project for Bolivia
            had the following ratings: the outcome was unsatisfactory,
            the sustainability was unlikely, the institutional
            development impact was unsatisfactory, and the Bank
            performance was satisfactory and the borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that
            program effectiveness is greatest in the area of the
            intergovernmental fiscal framework. Timing and objectives of
            the operation need to be more modest. The scope of the
            operation improperly excluded the intermediate level. In
            programmatic operations the counterpart institutions should
            remain the same. Technical assistance is required in
            parallel to the adjustment operation.
